definition: "shikumen" style architecture: traditional (ca. 19th century) residences with courtyards, once common in Shanghai
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The dust of history has been toward the Shikumen, this demonstrates a new vitality.
sentences.chinese: 本已走向历史烟尘的石库门，由此彰显了新的生命力。

sentences.english: The Site of First National Congress of CPC and Xintiandi are the best representative Shikumen-style complexes.
sentences.chinese: 石库门建筑群以一大会址和新天地为代表。

sentences.english: It is a house with stone- ringed door.
In my books, people sit in front of their shikumen [stone gate] houses and talk.
sentences.chinese: 在我的书里，人们坐在他们的石库门房子前聊天。

sentences.english: New world order to its new position and acting, rewritten Shikumen history.
sentences.chinese: 新天地，以它新的姿势和神髓，重写了石库门的历史。

sentences.english: The whole complex has become an outstanding spot with its exterior retaining the Shikumen architectural style.
sentences.chinese: 它成为了以石库门建筑为外立面的新天地的一大亮点。

definition: courtyard house with a fully enclosed courtyard (type of Chinese residence)
compound with many families living together
the Shanghai of old, with its foreign settlements/(fig.) a bustling, cosmopolitan city
Lao Cai, Vietnam/Laokai or Laukkai, Burma (Myanmar)
residence consisting of structures surrounding a courtyard on three sides
foreign concession, an enclave occupied by a foreign power (in China in the 19th and 20th centuries)
harmonious combination of Chinese and Western elements (idiom)
